weekly_top_story.headline: NYU Langone-supported foundation donates $250,000 to rare liver disease research following child loss
weekly_top_story.summary: The Jason Michael Brescia Foundation, supported by NYU Langone Hospital―Long Island, donated $250,000 to Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory for infantile liver failure syndrome (ILFS-1) research, aiming to prevent similar tragedies and promote broader genetic testing.
weekly_top_story.source: Long Island (NY) Herald via NYU Langone Health News

stories.headline: US Government shutdown intensifies healthcare policy showdown
stories.summary: With the US government shutdown ongoing, healthcare emerges as a central issue obstructing legislative progress, impacting policy stability and causing uncertainty for healthcare providers and patients.

stories.headline: CMS Administrator Oz addresses mixed reactions to Pfizer drug pricing deal in Medicaid
stories.summary: CMS Administrator Oz acknowledged concerns from Medicaid advocacy groups over the recent drug pricing deal with Pfizer, highlighting tensions between cost-saving initiatives and stakeholder trust.
